caption: I did not know about this until a friend told me. This is the former residence of French novelist Honor√© de Balzac. It was in the outskirts of Paris at the time. It was the guest house of a larger estate. It contains a lot of artifacts, drawings, sculptures and writing related to Balzac. The cottage is small but worth visiting. The main attraction for me is the outdoor garden.  A lot of flowers and plants and a lot of places just to sit and take in the quiet. A small cafe on site is very nice too. Definitely worth a visit.

We found this after seeing a post that it was a good place to see the Eiffel Tower. It is perfect to escape the crowds and enjoy history on author Balzac. The cafe and garden are small but lovely. We had a short coffee break and enjoyed the views. The museum of the house is free but exhibits are cost. It's definitely off the beaten path. It's delicious on all accounts. Stop at some of the nearby parks, too, if walking back.
Super museum full of Information. Guided visit highly recommended. The museum website has all of Balzac‚Äôs books online!
Cute little scape for a cultural afternoon program in Paris. After visiting the maison I sat in the garden with my friend to discuss Balzac. Coffee and pastry in hand too ;)
This place is completely free to visit. And has one of the best cafes to sit among nature and have a view of the Eiffel.

Cool to visit if you are a Balzac fan. If you are not a big Balzac fan, you will likely not appreciate it- especially since it is a long walk from the center of Paris. Small house with 2 floors (6 rooms total) and a garden and a cafe where you can get snacks/coffee/wine. No need to get tickets- the museum is free. I wish more of the content was translated into English.

Nice tour of Balzac's house (possibility of English audio interpretation via the downloaded app), there is also a cafe in the garden.  Visit in autumn: a minimum of people, pleasant sitting in the garden.

Such a beautiful house in a beautiful location. I almost thought I was not in Paris as it was absolutely stunning. The garden and house are authentic and very interesting as it retraces Balzac‚Äôs life. As for the spot, it‚Äôs int he 16th arrondissent with view on the Eiffel Tower, what an amazing neighbourhood! It‚Äôs also not too crowded and no need a ticket reservation.
I thought it would be boring but it was a pleasant surprise. It‚Äôs cozy, full of art, it has a caf√© and it‚Äôs just beautiful. Great for those who love Balzac. It‚Äôs also free :)

The museum offers interesting artworks and even if it's not as grand as other museums, i greatly enjoyed the intimate setting  The day i went there, there's an exhibition of Shrive which was very interesting.  BTW, entrance is free (when i went there)  so yaaay!

I was surprised when I was asked to buy an entrance ticket since according to the information I found online the museum was free. However, the visit was a very interesting experience and although small, the house is great for what it is. I'd just like to recommend to the owners to update the pricing information online: 6 euros didn't ruin my experience but I can't speak for everyone else.

What a magical and relaxing place. Besides the short visit in Balzac's house, having a coffee in the garden is a pleasure.  Yes, it will be an expensive coffee, but with free entrance you can consider it to be your entrance fee
Worth visiting for those interested in the domestic life of great writers, there‚Äôs a gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower from the garden

I truly enjoyed the English-style garden, the cicada song and the peaceful vibe of this place at the heart of the 16th arrondissement of Paris. Just a few minutes walk from the Passy metro station. The little ‚ÄúRose Bakery‚Äù cafe is clean and offers a selection of delicious homemade pastries and salads. Truly a great place to chill on a sunny summer day üçÉ
Very pleasant to visit. The exhibition space is interesting. Access to the garden is free and very beautiful. Coffee and snacks on site

for me the best spot for Eiffel tower view! I suggest a croissant on the menu would make this cafe even better place. there were only scones and cakes so I asked the staff for his recommendation, and he offered this carrot cake which was indeed delicious. also liked there iced coffee too!
Cute little space with a nice garden and a caf√©. You get to see various illustartions of his works. A nice calm hangout spot when the weather is nice, with the view of Eiffel

Unless you‚Äôre a huge fan of Balzac idk if you will find this interesting. Overall it‚Äôs nice to get acquainted with Balzac and his last years of life. But there aren‚Äôt many personal belongings and it‚Äôs more of a museum than a house. Either way, it is quite cheap (7 euros) and doesn‚Äôt take much time. There is a cafeteria inside so might just go in to chill and have coffee in the garden
We expected a bit more. There are no audio guides and the app os outdated and not to be installed on never versions of Android. The staff is nice, but the House is ready for some improvements.
If u want to discover more about Honor√© de Balzac and his masterpieces lik√© la Com√©die Humaine visit his georgous home with a beautiful view to the Eiffel Tower

I wish there were more English tutorials then the present. Still, it was astonishing to see where a prolific writer lived and worked. It has a nice view of Eiffel Tower and is in a nice neighbourhood. The staff are helpful. Tickets are 8 for adults 6 for students. I hope the museum will show more items in future.
Wonderful small museum about La Comedie Humaine writer Balzac. Awesome private yard at the heart of Passy.
Free museum next to Eiffel tower. The view is amazing. People come to read and study in the garden, you can sunbathe as well

Not a fan of Balzac, but it‚Äôs still interesting and illuminating to know more about him. The collections are well-organised and -displayed. The most polite, gentle and helpful staff I‚Äôve ever met in a museum!

Definitely worth a visit. The Maison de Balzac is off the beaten track and only someone embracing all sorts of arts would be interested in knowing the house where this prolific writer lived and worked from, I would think.

The locations are wonderful, a beautiful museum where you can see the life of a great writer, and the cafe and the garden are another thing of beauty , the kind, smiling guard makes you want to come back every day

What a great cafe. When you walk off the street instead of going ahead to the museum you can turn right and down the stairs to the cafe. And what a fantastic find. A quiet green garden with a view if the tower and a quiet oasis away from all the congestion around it. We enjoyed fabulous fresh healthy salads and quiche Lorraine. Don‚Äôt order coffee. We did and it was undrinkably awful. But they offer other drinks that cannot be ruined by man. Thoroughly recommend. Have lunch, sit in the garden and gaze at the tower. This is how Paris memories are constructed.

Such a glorious find! An almost hidden garden and caf√©, accessible whether or not you're visiting the museum. On a fine day, you can sit outside in the garden and feel as if you lead a privileged life in one of the best areas of Paris. The coffees are great (and we are talking proper coffee here - none of the Franch restaurant coffee and not American-style; if you regularly seek out "Australian" coffee, you will appreciate this place). The scones with butter and jam are surprisingly good. The service is variable. We had a lovely woman on our first visit and a man who could barely hide his contempt for us the second time. Still, given the location it was water off a duck's back.
An escape from the city in the city , beautiful garden , and a lovely little museum , great for an afternoon tea
A place of an author containing a lot  of small details about the life and work of Balzac can be found in this place.
A hidden spot in Paris with very good caf√© and a small museum in Balzac's house.

The museum is nice and everything but the cafe service is so so so slow. It‚Äôs amazing how bad and slow it can be. If you plan to have a coffee here, arm yourself with a tonne of patience before coming!
What a jewel! Loved the place at first sight! The museum is unique, the garden is gorgeous and the food is really good. Shall go there again just for the ambience!
Really interesting if small museum with a small garden space and cafe.
Good coffee, great selection of cakes, cute garden with view on the Eifel tower
It was a cute museum but almost none of the text and explanations were translated in English. If you dont know french, 7 euros might be too much for this museum.

There is supposed to be a library attached to this museum that is part of Paris's free public library network. Unfortunately, you need an advance reservation to use it and I'm not sure if there's a time restriction. So they were very nice about it but 1 star for being unusable/inaccessible by public library standrads.
Beautiful garden, romantic peaceful place with a pleasant caf√© with excellent products. Very interesting house full of Balzac‚Äôs personal items & furniture. And it‚Äôs free!
